page.title: 18CUSTOMS
page.content: Every year in June the{Govan Fair}is held. A "Queen" is chosen from the pupils of the local Primary Schools. On the first Friday in June they parade through the streets of Govan on floats with pipe bands and majorettes. At the end of June a Country Fair and Horse Show is held in Bellahouston Park. Famous showjumpers such as Harvey Smith display their talents. Policemen on horseback and trained Police dogs entertain the crowds. On October 31 children dress up in fancy clothes and go out for{ {Hallo'een.}They visit neighbours, sing a song and are usually given an apple and some peanuts. November 5 is known as{Guy Fawkes {Night.} Children usually attend a bonfire and set off fireworks.
